intro: Leea staphylea, commonly known as the Indian star anise or star anise, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and distinctive, star-shaped fruit. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit, which resembles a star, is the part used in traditional medicine and as a spice.
